message.content:
cs.HC, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.LG. 

The paper focuses on developing alternative modes of communication between humans and robots involved in collaborative tasks, particularly in engineered settings such as the factory floor or the assembly line in the manufacturing industry. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) and Robotics (cs.RO) categories. The paper also proposes the use of electroencephalographic (EEG) feedback to monitor human response to events and affective states, which can be used by a learning agent to modify its policy. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), Computer Vision (cs.CV), and Machine Learning (cs.LG) categories.
